722545f-a.text:
61 Perry Street, north side, west of West 4th Street. The 6-story apartment house, No. 59-57, partially shown on the right, adjoins the
N.W. corner of the two streets mentioned.
August 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

722546f-a.text:
62 to 86 Perry Street, south side, between West 4th and Bleecker Streets. This view is westward and shows houses that stand on a portion of the site of the home of Sir Peter Warren; the British Admiral who captured Louisburg. This property, last owned by Van Nest, was subdivided and built upon in 1867.
August 3, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
Neeg ~ 11i99

722547f-a.text:
Perry Street, north side, west from No. 71, a structure midway between West 4th and Bleecker Streets and across the latter to Hudson Street. The white buildings shown occupy the N.E. and N.W. corners of Bleecker Street.

August 3, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
